verses.text: 以試煉為喜樂　神和主耶穌基督的僕人雅各，向散居各地的十二支派問安。

words.note: Refers to spiritual tests or trials.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual joy.
The inverted triangle is often used in Chinese Bibles to highlight 'God' as a proper noun.
In a biblical context, often refers to a servant of God.
Refers to Jewish people living outside Israel.
Refers to the twelve tribes of Israel.

verses.text: 我的弟兄們，你們遭遇各種試煉的時候，都要看為喜樂；

words.note: Often used for fellow believers in Christian contexts.
Refers to spiritual tests or trials.
Often used in religious contexts for spiritual joy.

verses.text: 因為知道你們的信心經過考驗，就產生忍耐。
但忍耐要堅持到底（「堅持到底」原文作「有完全的功效」），使你們可以完全，毫無缺乏。

words.note: An idiom meaning to persist to the very end.
Quoted for textual clarification.
In a biblical sense, often implies spiritual maturity or wholeness.

verses.text: 你們中間若有人缺少智慧，就當向那厚賜眾人，而且不斥責人的　神祈求，他就必得著。

words.note: Refers to God, specified by the following clauses.
Often found in biblical or formal contexts.
The inverted triangle is often used in Chinese Bibles to highlight 'God' as a proper noun.

verses.text: 可是，他應該憑著信心祈求，不要有疑惑；因為疑惑的人，就像被風吹蕩翻騰的海浪。

words.note: A core theological concept in the Bible.

verses.text: 那樣的人，不要想從主得到甚麼；

words.note: Refers to God or Jesus Christ.

verses.text: 因為三心兩意的人，在他的一切道路上，都搖擺不定。

words.note: Idiom: 'three hearts, two minds', meaning conflicted.

verses.text: 富貴榮華轉眼消逝卑微的弟兄應當以高升為榮；

words.note: A set phrase describing worldly prosperity and status.

words.definition: in a flash, in an instant

words.note: Often used in the Bible for fellow believers.
Refers to spiritual or social elevation.

verses.text: 富足的也不應該以降卑為辱；因為他如同草上的花，必要過去。

words.note: Refers to a lowering of status or self-humiliation.

words.definition: to pass away, to go by

verses.text: 太陽一出，熱風一吹，草必枯乾，花必凋謝，它的美容就消失了；富足的人也必在他的奔波經營中這樣衰落。

words.note: Describes hurried, busy activity like running about in waves.

verses.text: 忍受試煉的人有福了能忍受試煉的人，是有福的；因為他經過考驗之後，必得著生命的冠冕，這冠冕是主應許給愛他的人的。

words.note: Refers to a refining trial or test from God.
Often used in religious contexts for divine blessing.
Refers to a refining trial or test from God.
Often used in religious contexts for divine blessing.
Biblical usage, suggesting active reception.
Refers to a symbolic or literal crown, often with religious significance.
Refers to a symbolic or literal crown, often with religious significance.
Refers to God or Jesus Christ in a religious context.
Frequently used for God's promises in scripture.

verses.text: 人被試探，不可說「我被　神試探」；因為　神不能被惡試探，他也不試探任何人。

words.note: Often refers to moral or spiritual temptation.
Refers to the Christian God, often elevated.
Often refers to moral or spiritual temptation.
Refers to the Christian God, often elevated.
Often refers to moral or spiritual temptation.
Often refers to moral or spiritual temptation.

verses.text: 每一個人受試探，都是被自己的私慾所勾引誘惑的。

words.note: Often refers to moral or spiritual temptation.
Refers to illicit or carnal desires, often in a religious or moral context.
Used in passive structures to emphasize the agent.

verses.text: 私慾懷了胎，就生出罪；罪長成了，就產生死亡。

words.note: Refers to illicit or carnal desires, often in a religious or moral context.
A core theological concept in Christianity.
A core theological concept in Christianity.
In this context, often implies spiritual or eternal death.

verses.text: 我親愛的弟兄們，不要看錯了。

words.note: Refers to fellow believers in Christ.

verses.text: 各樣美好的賞賜，各樣完備的恩賜，都是從上面、從眾光之父降下來的，他本身並沒有改變，也沒有轉動的影子。

words.definition: all kinds of, every sort of

words.note: Implies a gift from a superior or divine source.

words.definition: all kinds of, every sort of

words.note: Often refers to spiritual gifts given by divine grace.
Contextually referring to God's dwelling place.
A biblical title for God.

verses.text: 他憑著自己的旨意，藉著真理的道生了我們，使我們作他所造的萬物中初熟的果子。

words.note: Often refers to God's divine will.
In Christian context, often refers to God's Word or Christ.
Refers to all creation.
Refers to the first and best of a harvest, symbolic of an offering or chosen people.

verses.text: 要作行道的人我親愛的弟兄們，你們要知道，人人都應該快快地聽，慢慢地說，慢一點動怒；

words.note: To live according to God's word.
Refers to fellow believers in Christ.

verses.text: 因為人的忿怒並不能成全　神的義。

words.note: Often refers to fulfilling God's will or righteousness.
Reverential space often precedes the character for God in Chinese Bibles.
Often refers to God's moral perfection and just character.

verses.text: 所以你們應當擺脫一切污穢和所有的邪惡，以溫柔的心領受　神栽種的道；這道能救你們的靈魂。

words.note: Often used in a spiritual sense referring to disposition.
The preceding space is a reverent typographic convention for God.
Used metaphorically for 'the word implanted'.
Here refers to the Word of God or divine truth.

verses.text: 你們應該作行道的人，不要單作聽道的人，自己欺騙自己；

words.definition: practice the word, obey the word
words.note: Verb-object compound: to act upon or obey the Word of God.
Verb-object compound: to hear the Word of God.

verses.text: 因為人若只作聽道的人，不作行道的人，他就像一個人對著鏡子看自己本來的面貌，
看過走開以後，馬上就忘記自己的樣子。

words.note: Lit. 'on horse', indicating swiftness.

verses.text: 唯有詳細察看那使人自由的全備的律法，並且時常遵守的人，他不是聽了就忘記，而是實行出來，就必因自己所作的蒙福。

words.note: Refers to something fully equipped and flawless.
Often refers to God's Law or the Mosaic Law in the Bible.
Directional complement indicating realization or emergence.
Forms a nominal phrase from a verb, indicating object or result.

verses.text: 如果有人自以為虔誠，卻不約束他的舌頭，反而自己欺騙自己，這人的虔誠是沒有用的。

words.note: Refers to religious devotion.
Here used as a noun.
Common phrase for 'useless'.
Used to form an adjectival phrase.

verses.text: 在父　神看來，純潔無玷污的虔誠，就是照顧患難中的孤兒寡婦，並且保守自己不被世俗所污染。

words.note: A respectful title for God in Christianity.
Lit. 'without stain or defilement'.
Commonly used in biblical contexts for 'suffering'.
Suffix indicating 'within' or 'amidst'.
Often paired with 被 for passive voice.
